snippet: Farmers from western and central New York, struggling to find a reliable supply of labor, say they have come under growing scrutiny from the immigration authorities.
abstract: Dairy farmers from western and central New York, struggling to find reliable supply of labor, say they have come under growing scrutiny from immigration authorities; like agriculture in general, most dairy farms rely on newly arrived foreign-born workers because United States citizens simply do not want these jobs; critics argue that better wages would end apparent shortfall in legal laborers.
lead_paragraph: Farmers from western and central New York, struggling to find a reliable supply of labor, say they have come under growing scrutiny from the immigration authorities.

headline.seo: In Immigration Debate, a Focus on New York Dairy Farmers
headline.main: Focus on Dairy Farmers in Immigration Debate
headline.print_headline: Focus on Dairy Farmers in Immigration Debate
